results.purpose: Track and manage trial box subscription resets for KN (Kenya) customers who experienced payment failures, and cancel subscriptions with 5+ failed payment attempts
key_data_points: Reset window: 4 weeks maximum before cancellation

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: New customers signing up for trial boxes

entities.name: New Ventures Tech team
entities.context: Team responsible for manually resetting subscriptions back to trial SKU

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food
entities.context: Slack channel for submitting reset requests to engineering team

entities.name: BOB
entities.context: Platform used for bulk subscription cancellations

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Database platform where queries are executed

entities.name: CC (Customer Care)
entities.context: Team that identifies subscriptions needing resets in 'CC KN Reset' tab

insights: Two-tier process: subscriptions with 5+ failed payments are canceled immediately, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status
Schedule-based workflow: Tuesday processes Saturday-Tuesday deliveries, Friday processes Wednesday-Friday deliveries
Manual intervention required: Engineering team must manually reset trial SKUs through Slack ticket system
Payment failure prevention: 4-week maximum window prevents indefinite failed order creation
Trial box pricing protection: Process ensures customers receive promised trial pricing on second box attempt
Automated query filters for unshipped boxes, trial products, non-canceled subscriptions, and customers with zero loyalty (new customers)
Cancellation reason standardized as 'CC-Failed-Payments' for tracking purposes

results.purpose: Tracks marketing test campaigns and A/B tests for Good Chop across different channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail) with various promotional offers and pricing structures
key_data_points: Campaign naming convention: Quarter [Channel] Offer Description
Common pricing structures: $100, $120, $140, $150 with various discount splits (50-30-20, 50-30-20-20, etc.)
Promotional offers: Free Ground Beef, Free Ribeyes, Welcome Kits, Choose Your Offer/Meat/Protein
Test periods spanning 2023 Q1-Q2 through 2025 Q2-Q3
FL (First-time/Limited) and FY (For You/Forever) offer types

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) campaign tests for both New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand channels

entities.name: yukie.yamamoto@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of Facebook (FB) campaign tests across multiple quarters

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM, CRM-CA (Canada), and Direct Mail (DM) campaign tests, primarily for 2023 campaigns

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat delivery/subscription service running promotional test campaigns

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent company or partner organization (based on email domain of one owner)

insights: Heavy focus on Q2 and Q3 2025 testing, indicating active campaign planning and optimization
Facebook is the most tested channel with 9 tests listed, followed by SEM with 6 tests
Pricing strategy centers around $100-$150 total discounts split across multiple orders (typically 3-5 orders)
Common A/B test structure compares different offer types (e.g., Welcome Kit vs Free Product, different protein options)
Geographic expansion evident with separate CRM-CA (Canada) tests
Ownership transition visible: older tests (2023) owned by HelloFresh email, newer tests (2025) owned by Good Chop domain emails
Product focus on premium items: Ribeyes, Ground Beef, Ground Sirloin, and curated Welcome Kits
One unique test references 'Tariff-Proof Copy' suggesting response to economic/trade conditions
Most recent modifications cluster in June-July 2025, indicating active campaign management

results.purpose: Tracks marketing voucher codes for free product promotions at Good Chop, a meat/food delivery service
key_data_points: 14 different voucher code types (BCN, BFY, WNG, WFY, GFY, GFL, SFY, RFY, RFL, RGY, MFY, MFL, NFY, NFL, CFY)
Two duration types: 'For Life' and 'For Year' promotions
Multiple promotional campaigns: TURKEY, TRK, GBL, TRKXA series
Products include: Bacon, Chicken Wings, Ground Beef, Salmon, Ribeyes, Filet Mignon, NY Strip, Cheesecake

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Company offering meat and food subscription service with promotional vouchers

entities.name: ODL
entities.context: Referenced as source system for customer IDs and data integration

entities.name: Turkey Campaign
entities.context: Major promotional campaign with multiple variants (TURKEY ACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY REACTIVATION NAE, TURKEY CODE 2023)

insights: Premium products (Ribeyes, Filet Mignon, NY Strip) are offered as both lifetime and yearly promotions, suggesting high-value customer acquisition strategy
Turkey promotions appear to be a major campaign with multiple customer segments and activation types
Email banners are active for most voucher types (TRUE flag), except for some lifetime promotions (MFL, NFL)
The spreadsheet contains extensive customer ID lists (100+ IDs) suggesting large-scale promotional campaigns
Product offerings span multiple protein categories (beef, chicken, pork, seafood) plus dessert, indicating diverse product portfolio
Voucher codes use systematic prefixes based on product type and duration (e.g., BFY = Bacon For Year, BCN = Bacon)
Multiple promotional code series (TRKXA1A, TRKXA1B, etc.) suggest segmented or sequential campaign rollouts

results.doc_title: [VIEW ONLY] F_ Meal & Add On Database
results.purpose: Meal planning and recipe database for a meal delivery service, tracking nutritional information, costs, ratings, dietary attributes, and operational details
key_data_points: 1,901 total ratings for Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
Last run date: 2023-W49 for graveyard items

entities.name: NS
entities.context: Chef's initials for Greek Isle Caper Salmon recipe

entities.name: AS
entities.context: Chef's initials for Greek-Style Market Chicken Bowl and Red Pepper Bruschetta Chicken

entities.name: SH
entities.context: Chef's initials for Garlic Tomato Cream Shredded Beef

entities.name: Chicken & Mushroom Marsala
entities.context: Multiple recipe variants (F00002A-F) marked as 'Graveyard' status

entities.name: Greek Isle Caper Salmon
entities.context: New recipe with highest max cost at $4.85

entities.name: Greek-Style Market Chicken Bowl
entities.context: New recipe with highest protein content at 44g

insights: Multiple recipe variants exist for the same meal with slight cost and nutritional differences
Chicken & Mushroom Marsala has been discontinued ('Graveyard' status) despite having 1,901 ratings
New recipes (F01905-F01908) are pending approval with 10/21/2025 approval date
All meals are marked as 'Calorie Smart', 'Chef's Choice', 'High Protein', 'Pork Free', and 'Low Carb'
European/Italian cuisine dominates the recipe selection
Salmon-based meals have significantly higher max costs ($4.85) compared to chicken ($2.54-$2.96)
GLP-1 dietary support is tracked, indicating focus on weight management meal options
Recipes use color-coded sleeves (Yellow, Blue, Red) likely for operational sorting
All new recipes feature shredded proteins or salmon, suggesting operational efficiency focus

results.purpose: Tracks the percentage of operational overhead (KTLO - Keep The Lights On work) per month for New Ventures teams
key_data_points: Percentage of operational overhead per month

entities.name: New Ventures
entities.context: Parent organization/project containing multiple teams being tracked

entities.name: Jira
entities.context: Ticketing system used as data source for tracking KTLO work

entities.name: KTLO
entities.context: Label used to categorize Keep The Lights On operational work in Jira

insights: Each team has a dedicated tab for tracking their specific operational overhead
Automated daily updates via cron job ensure data freshness without manual intervention
System relies on proper labeling (KTLO) and story point assignment for accuracy
Uses resolved date to attribute tickets to specific months for temporal tracking
Requires retrospective story point assignment for accurate overhead calculation
Operational overhead is calculated as a ratio of KTLO work to total work completed

results.purpose: Tracks customer service interactions and feedback related to cross-selling Factor meals to HelloFresh customers
key_data_points: 7 customer interactions recorded between October 26 - November 24, 2025
Multiple cases of unauthorized/unexpected Factor orders
Mix of Message (6) and Voice (1) communication channels
No compensation amounts recorded in any cases

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary meal kit subscription service experiencing cross-sell issues

entities.name: Factor
entities.context: Ready-to-eat meal service being cross-sold to HelloFresh customers, causing confusion and complaints

insights: Significant customer confusion about Factor cross-sell program - customers receiving Factor orders they don't recall placing
Multiple customers unaware that Factor and HelloFresh are separate accounts/subscriptions
Pattern of customers discovering unwanted Factor orders after cut-off period, preventing cancellation
Cross-sell acceptance process appears unclear, leading to accidental opt-ins
Customer dissatisfaction leading to account cancellations and disputes
Lack of clarity about Factor meals coming in separate boxes vs same delivery
Website glitches mentioned affecting order totals and pricing
Self-managing account model causing friction when customers don't actively customize orders

results.doc_title: 2025 ANZ Christmas Offering Business Case | XMB+XMO
results.purpose: Tracks project team assignments, leads, and workstream responsibilities for the 2025 ANZ (Australia/New Zealand) Christmas Offering business initiative across XMB+XMO brands
key_data_points: Separate AU (Australia) and NZ (New Zealand) leads for most functions
Multiple workstreams already in progress (Ideation done, Project set up, Recipes created, NID onboarding started)
Cross-functional team spanning Product, Engineering, Operations, Marketing, Finance, FSQA, and more

entities.name: Tiffany Zhu
entities.context: Lead AU for ANZ Product Strategy

entities.name: Elyse Hill
entities.context: ANZ Project Manager Lead

entities.name: Hannah Gilbert
entities.context: Stakeholder for multiple workstreams (Culinary Innovation, CIO Dev, Editorial, Digital Ops)

entities.name: Francois Lubrano
entities.context: Stakeholder for Project Management, Procurement Ops, Menu Planning

entities.name: XMB+XMO
entities.context: Target brands for 2025 Christmas Offering

entities.name: 2025 Christmas Offering
entities.context: Main project being tracked across ANZ markets

insights: Project shows clear regional separation with dedicated AU and NZ leads for most operational functions (Logistics, Procurement, Production, FSQA)
Early-stage progress evident: ideation and recipe development completed, onboarding processes initiated
Heavy cross-functional coordination required with Hannah Gilbert as common stakeholder across 5 workstreams
Strategic Procurement lists multiple personnel with specific category codes (PTN, PHF, PCK, GRO) indicating specialized supplier management
Duplication work identified for Marketing campaigns, recipe booklets, and website content suggesting parallel market launches
Some workstreams still have TBD (To Be Determined) secondary leads, indicating team structure still being finalized
FSQA (Food Safety & Quality Assurance) explicitly noted as needing to onboard SKUs for both markets, highlighting compliance requirements
